title: Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) Recipe
description: This flan de queso is a smooth cream cheese flan topped with a golden caramel. It is an elegant dessert that can be baked and chilled until serving.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 4.8 (64) 50 Reviews 32 Photos This flan de queso is my favorite recipe, learned from my mother. People love it and ask me for the recipe every time they try it, so here it is. I find it tastes better cold. Submitted by damaris Updated on August 25, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 32 32 32 32 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 50 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs 5 mins Total Time: 3 hrs 10 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 9-inch flan Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 6 large eggs 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ⅓ cup 2% milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 cup white sugar Directions Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, cream cheese, milk, and vanilla extract in a blender; blend until smooth. Place sugar in an even layer in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the edges start to brown, about 1 minute; drag sugar into the center with a spatula once the edges start to brown. Continue cooking, stirring from time to time, until caramel is an even golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Meanwhile, pour 1 inch boiling water into a large oven-safe pot or baking dish to make a water bath. Pour caramel into a 9-inch flan mold or baking pan; swirl so that caramel reaches 1 inch up the sides. Pour the condensed milk mixture on top. Set in the water bath. Set the flan and water bath in the preheated oven; bake until a damp table knife inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Chill flan in the refrigerator until firm, 2 to 3 hours. Invert onto a serving plate so that caramel is on top. Recipe Tip You'll need a flan mold (or a standard tube pan) and a pot for the bain-marie (water bath) that's big enough to comfortably accommodate the mold. I Made It Print 140 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 475 Calories 22g Fat 58g Carbs 14g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 475 % Daily Value * Total Fat 22g 28% Saturated Fat 12g 62% Cholesterol 202mg 67% Sodium 252mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 58g 21% Total Sugars 57g Protein 14g 29% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 317mg 24% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 425mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 01 of 32 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 32 Photo by  PlushYeast3623 03/02/2024 A keeper! Family favorite 03 of 32 Photo by  JazzyPie5931 12/12/2023 04 of 32 Photo by  SandyBun8541 05/23/2023 Cheese flan was great ! I usually make the traditional but I was constantly being ask about cheese flan. I finally made it and everyone loves it , I have no regrets choosing this recipe. 05 of 32 Photo by  wendyylove38 01/19/2022 Adore this, the title made me cry bc i was missing my mom, and this tasted like her kitchen I recommend leaving the cream cheese out for an hour dont use it cold straight from the fridge, and for a thicker consistency make a thinner batch , for a juicy consistency make it in a deeper dish and tall Love love love it 06 of 32 Photo by  lizzard 05/08/2021 I made this for my very health conscientious book club. Desserts are usually minimal. Everyone loved it so much, they all had seconds. I even got a “mouthgasm “ comment. I loved it too. So good the next day too. Enjoy, it’s a must make. 07 of 32 Photo by  jmgeno 02/15/2021 08 of 32 Photo by  jmgeno 02/15/2021 09 of 32 Photo by  XennoTech Industries 11/18/2020 I made this for my girlfriend's birthday. She had requested it over another sweet i wanted to make for her. I was going to just pay someone to make one for me but decided to try this recipe out. We had a party at the office for her and i brought this as one of her gifts.
